src.model.process

Helper functions for processing training data in a scikit pipeline.

Instead of creating bespoke classes that inherit from scikit, we’ll rely on the FunctionTransformer to make them compatible with scikit pipelines. https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.preprocessing.FunctionTransformer.html

The preprocess function is reserved for model-agnostic transformations that should be done before building the scikit pipelines.

src.model.process.preprocess(X, features)[source]

Apply preprocessing transformations.

Parameters:

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – a set of training or test data

  • features (dict) – features metadata from a config file

Returns:

preprocessed training or test data

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.model.process.reduce_columns(X, columns)[source]

Reduce a set of training or test data to a subset of columns.

Parameters:

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – a set of training or test data

  • columns (list) – a list of columns to keep

Returns:

a set of training or test data with a subset of columns

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.model.process.set_precision(X, precision_map)[source]

Set the precision for certain columns in a training or test set.

Parameters:

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – a set of training or test data

  • precision_map (dict) – mapping of column names and precision values

Returns:

a set of training or test data with precision set

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

src.model.process.transform_home_away_structure(X, y)[source]

Convert home/away structure to object/adversary structure.

Parameters:

  • X (pd.DataFrame) – a set of training or test data

  • y (pd.DataFrame) – a set of training or test labels

Returns:

a set of training or test data with object/adversary structure

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
